wikipedia_page.main: Ralph Douglas Stacey (*October 1948 in  Johannesburg); † 4 September 2021 in London) was a British organizational theorist and Professor of Management at Hertfordshire Business School, University of Hertfordshire, in the UK and one of the pioneers of enquiring into the implications of the natural sciences of complexity for understanding human organisations and their management. He is best known for his writings on the theory of organisations as complex responsive processes of relating.
